items.title: Looking for Lead Maintainers
items.content: We are activley looking for more developers to help take this project to the next level. If interested please email nmccready.

items.title: Website updates
items.content: The community has been chipping in on the documentation which has been great! Keep it coming please!

items.title: What is next, 2.1.X or 3.0.X?
items.content:
Things are changing for the good, and we want your input. Please read the README.md and vote at the Poll.
Voting will end Dec 20th!.

items.title: Like writing Specs?
items.content: Do you like picking libraries apart? Then we need you! We really need better coverage against our directives, factories, and services. This would help catch regression errors. This would go a long way beyond plunkrs and examples.

items.title: Polylines and Polygons
items.content: These plural directives currently allow for both expressions and key (model) evaluations. We will be trying to upgrade the other plural directives to include these features as well. This functionality is currently on master and will be in the 2.0.12 release.

items.title: 2.0.11 Documentation Added
items.content: All of the documentation has been updated to the master API. We are still behind on documenting many updates and changes. As a community feel free to pull request (PR) changes to keep this websit up to date.

items.title: 1.1.0 Documentation Added
items.content: Many undocumented directives/features are now.. documented :). Documentation now reflects 1.1.0 (was develop branch)!!

items.title: New change log page
items.content: We now have a brand new page hosting the changelog of angular-google-maps! It's over here!

items.title: GeoJSON support
items.content: The google-maps, circle, marker, markers, polygon, polyline, window & windows directive now support GeoJSON coordindates, in addition to the standard latitude/longitude object parameters. See the docs!

items.title: Layer directive hotfix
items.content:
There was a bug in the layer directive which prevented passing options to the underlying layer. This has been fixed in version 1.0.10.

Thanks netmonster01 for reporting this!

items.title: New directive: rectangle
items.content: Thanks to ChenTsuLin, we now have a rectangle directive. See the docs!

items.title: New website is finally online!
items.content: We are pleased to announce that our new website is finally online over at http://angular-google-maps.org ! The demo is still under development and the docs are almost 100% finished. Please leave your feedback over at our Google+ community or file issues in our issue tracker.

items.title: Official Google+ community
items.content: We now have our Google+ community! Please join to share your experience with this library, tips and tricks and to receive official announcements.

items.title: angular-google-maps 1.0.0 released!
items.content:
We are proud to announce that the first stable version of angular-google-maps has just be released!

The r1-dev branch has been merged back in master, and the old library is available in the legacy branch.

items.title: New website in the works
items.content: A brand new website for angular-google-maps is in the works. It will be more complete than the actual one and actually provide a complete API documentation as well as a quickstart guide. It will replace the existing site as soon as the next library version is released.

items.title: master branch moving to legacy soon
items.content: For users of the current master branch, please note that it will renamed to legacy as soon as r1-dev has been completed and tagged as a release. The angular-google-maps website will reflect the api of the new master branch.

items.title: AngularJS 1.2 support
items.content: angular-google-maps supports AngularJS 1.2 in the r1-dev branch, which will become the master branch once released.

items.title: Code overhaul
items.content:
A new branch has been created which will be used to rewrite most of angular-google-maps and split it in separate directives. This will allow a simplified development process and easier overall integration in your projects.

Check out the r1-dev branch now!
